feed.title: Comments on Looking at Wiki
feed.subtitle: I've not just been spending time looking at social networking services, I've also been digging deeper into wiki. I've still got more to go, but some of these will be of interest to you if you are considering implementing a wiki for your community, or if you are a wiki developer...(brief touches on Zwiki, FlexWiki, ProjectForum, CourseForum, WikidPad, SocialText, SeedWiki, TWiki, and Meatball Wiki.)

entry.title: Zbigniew Lukasiak commented on 'Looking at Wiki'

link.title: The canonical list of wikis is at: http://www.c2.com/cgi/wiki?WikiEngines A very interesting collaborative internet medium http://aux.planetmath.org/noosphere/main.html It is not a wiki...

entry.summary: The canonical list of wikis is at: http://www.c2.com/cgi/wiki?WikiEngines A very interesting collaborative internet medium http://aux.planetmath.org/noosphere/main.html It is not a wiki...
entry.content:
The canonical list of wikis is at: http://www.c2.com/cgi/wiki?WikiEngines

A very interesting collaborative internet medium http://aux.planetmath.org/noosphere/main.html It is not a wiki - but it is close in the collaborative process.

entry.title: LionKimbro commented on 'Looking at Wiki'

link.title: The importance of wiki is that WikiIsDocumentBased. ( http://communitywiki.org/WikiIsDocumentBased ) IM, IRC, e-mail, all that stuff is message based. This...

entry.summary: The importance of wiki is that WikiIsDocumentBased. ( http://communitywiki.org/WikiIsDocumentBased ) IM, IRC, e-mail, all that stuff is message based. This...
entry.content:
The importance of wiki is that WikiIsDocumentBased.
( http://communitywiki.org/WikiIsDocumentBased )

IM, IRC, e-mail, all that stuff is message based. This is the first document based medium.

Documents are big heavy things that float around for long periods of time. Messages are flitty things that are useful for a very short period of time. Documents are good for stabilizing massive teachings that don't change often. Messages are good for coordinations and handling new things quickly.

We need both. Wiki is essential.

entry.title: wikuser commented on 'Looking at Wiki'

link.title: Flexwiki doesn't even work with my Mozilla browser. I'd also recommend MediaWiki (used for all the Wikipedia sites), SnipSnap (java...

entry.summary: Flexwiki doesn't even work with my Mozilla browser. I'd also recommend MediaWiki (used for all the Wikipedia sites), SnipSnap (java...
entry.content:
Flexwiki doesn't even work with my Mozilla browser.

I'd also recommend MediaWiki (used for all the Wikipedia sites), SnipSnap (java based wiki+blog), and Tiki.

entry.title: stuart henshall commented on 'Looking at Wiki'
Christopher Allen commented on 'Looking at Wiki'

link.title: Yes, I do know about those features, but I hadn't intended for this post to be an exhaustive review, just...

entry.summary: Yes, I do know about those features, but I hadn't intended for this post to be an exhaustive review, just...
entry.content:
Yes, I do know about those features, but I hadn't intended for this post to be an exhaustive review, just a paragraph in or so for each. The fact that you have lots of features is why I referred people to the public rss-winterfest site.

I am thinking about doing some more detailed reviews soon, though, and SocialText is near the top of the list.

entry.title: Adina Levin commented on 'Looking at Wiki'

link.title: Chris, have you seen the Socialtext feature to create private areas? Other distinctive capabilities include email integration, and integrated weblogs?...

entry.content:

- Adina
